text: hey guys thomas joseph here with another
kitchen conundrum now are you one that
sits there eggnog in the corner at the
holiday party because you're fearful of
those dum-dum
those raw eggs and your eggnog there's
no need to go out and buy that
pasteurized version at the grocery store
today we're gonna make a eggnog base
that is heated so those eggs are brought
up to the right temperature and it's
safe to drink and you can drink so much
of it so we're gonna start with heating
everything up I have two quarts of whole
milk here this goes right into a wide
bottom pot and to this I'm going to add
two and 2/3 cup of granulated sugar and
for a little bit of flavoring since it
is the holiday season and you want this
to be special I'm going to add one
vanilla bean that I'm going to scrape
now if you don't have any vanilla beans
on hand you could certainly use vanilla
extract or even that vanilla bean paste
that you see in the supermarket these
days those are good options as well what
you're gonna do is just split the beam
down the center and then take the back
of the knife and just glide it right
through and you should be able to pick
up all of those millions of tiny little
vanilla bean seeds and this is really
where the flavor is gonna come from so
that goes right into your pot along with
the pot itself that will help to infuse
the milk so we're gonna heat this
mixture up you don't want to boil it you
just want to simmer it gently until it
infuses the sugar dissolves and the
mixture is hot so you can get cracking
on your egg yolks I already have them
done here 16 egg yolks save those whites
for something else but this really adds
the richness the depth
it makes egg nog extra special so don't
skimp here on the egg yolks our milk
mixture is nice and hot the sugar has
dissolved now for the technique of
tempering I'm gonna take some of this
hot milk liquid and I'm going to pour it
into my yolks and whisk vigorously now
it's a little hard to do this with just
two hands I need like three and I'm
gonna use this little Bowl here which is
fine because I'm only gonna ladle in
maybe two scoops of this hot milk
mixture so all I do is just
or it right in whisk whisk whisk and
really what you're doing is you're
bringing the egg yolks up to temperature
so that when you dump it back into the
pot they don't scramble so there we go
we got three ladles there and now this
is going to go into your pot here and
you're going to cook this mixture until
it's nice and thick and it coats the
back of a wooden spoon and that's called
nap a consistency and it also will allow
the egg yolks to come up to a
temperature that is safe to eat and
that's about a hundred and sixty degrees
Fahrenheit so this will take about 20
minutes to get to that nice thick
consistency I have this on a medium heat
and I'm gonna stir slowly but constantly
so our milk mixture here is nice and
thick it smells delicious and now I'm
just gonna strain it through a fine mesh
sieve to fish out that vanilla bean and
then this now this base mixture here
needs to go into the refrigerator you
can put a piece of plastic wrap directly
on top chill this completely right
before serving so the eggnog base is
nice and cold here you can see how thick
it gets once it chills and to this for
just you know to gild the lily even more
I'm going to add two cups of heavy cream
and again this is chilled because you
want everything to be nice and cold stir
this together now to spike our eggnog
here I'm going to use a half cup of dark
rum so pour that right in and a half cup
of a really good quality bourbon now
some people will also add cognac or
brandy into this as well and you could
certainly do that I add a little bit
more bourbon just because I'm a bourbon
kind of guy and of course fun it's the
holidays right this looks awesome
I'm gonna transfer it now to my punch

effort you guys you might as well
present it like a pro now to top it off
I'm going to add a little bit more
whipped cream and just add them as
little pillows on top of your eggnog
they're like little clouds that kind of
all over the place and of course eggnog
would be incomplete without a little bit
of freshly grated nutmeg over the top
that adds that little extra spice and I
can't wait I'm gonna try this you guys
this is one of my favorite things during
the holiday season going right for the
